website_summaries.verdict: We recommend the Canon Pixma MG6120 compact multifunction printer for its simple touch-sensitive control panel, HD Movie Print feature, and capable performance.
pros: The Pixma MG6120 uses Canon's new Intelligent Touch System and adds wireless connectivity with an auto-document feeder to its generous list of features
cons: The Pixma's oversensitive virtual buttons make it too easy to activate the wrong function

customer_reviews.title: Will drive you crazy with low ink messages
customer_reviews.text: This is really a very good printer for the money and I'm not going to repeat what's in other reviews. But no one has pointed out yet that this printer will drive you crazy with "Low Ink" messages starting when a single cartridge is less than about 25% full. I started getting the messages a couple of months ago and it's still printing everything just fine. But it's very annoying because I have to click past the messages and sometimes press the OK button on the printer every time I print. If I were a more cynical person, I might suspect that they set these message threshholds just to encourage people to replace the cartridges before they're anywhere near empty.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Best photo printer ever! Lightning fast!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this printer for a few years now and it’s bybfar the best I’ve ever used. I mainly bought it as a photo printer. It produces amazing photos! I’ve framed many and give them as gifts. I also use it as an everyday (and i use it several times a day!) printer. It prints lightning quick. Love the WiFi capabilities. Ink lasts a long time and I even found an inexpensive off brand ink that works! I recommend it a million times over.
customer_reviews.author: KHenn

customer_reviews.title: Ink dries out without using!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't write harsh reviews but I have had enough with this printer. I have used many Canon printers before, but this is the first one that the ink will get depleted even if you have not been using it! The ink as it is, is already expensive enough. I would be okay if I am paying for consumption, but if I am also paying for time and I need to replace it every 3 months without even printing a single piece of photo, the math simply doesn't add up and I may as well print from professional shops. I hope Canon will fix in its next generation of printers.
customer_reviews.author: DARTHBL

customer_reviews.title: Ink does not last....
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this works. However, I've been an owner for about 3 years, and the biggest negative is that ink does not last. In fact, I think there is a diminishing return everytime I replace the ink cartridges. Now, the new ink cartridges last about 10 pages. That's like $2 per page. When I bought this, I read some of the negative comments regarding short ink life, and I regret not heeding the warnings. I'm not know how the reviews are above 3 stars. Don't buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: BevoChan

customer_reviews.title: No good for recent Macs
customer_reviews.text: If you have an up-to-date Apple computer, don't even think of buying this. The scanning software hasn't been updated to OS X 10.11 El Capitan. Worse yet, the scanning software supplied when I bought it now runs amok, using about 150% of the CPU, making the fan in my MacBook Pro run like crazy. I located the process causing that and deleted it, but some evil daemon recreates it every time I log in. I did like it before before this, but this is the second time I've been shafted because Canon didn't update the scanning software. I won't buy another of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Delany

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with this printer - especially for the low price. Granted, I haven't gone through a lot of ink yet so maybe it will get expensive later. I use this to print proofs for my photography customers and the quality seems more than adequate for that. Obviously it doesn't print well enough for me to stop getting my final prints from the pro lab, but for this price I certainly didn't expect that. Overall very happy with this printer. It exceeds my expectations. One very nice feature worth mentioning is the wireless capability... I'm able to easily print from any computer (even my iPad) without problem.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Horrible printer.
customer_reviews.text: It scans well, and it copied well, which was all I needed until a couple of weeks ago. That is when I discovered that it would not print. I spent a couple of days with Canon support and online, and I finally found a solution that worked. It worked for about 20 pages. Now it says there is no paper, when I have given it all sorts of paper, ruffled it gently, hand-fed it to the printer, etc. Now I am desperately trying not to recreate that scene from "Office Space". I have worked in a lot of offices with a lot of equipment, but this is by far the worst piece I've dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I love my Canon PIXMA MG6120 and use it with my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love my Canon PIXMA MG6120 and use it with my WIN XP computer, and remotely from my WIN 7 laptop. However, it _cannot_ be installed to work either remotely nor actually with my husband's WIN 7 desktop eMachines computer - something to do with the Registry. My experience with the printer from the WIN XP desktop and my Acer Laptop is excellent: great photos, good text (tho' not as dark as I might wish). It's ink usage is fairly conservative. I especially like the duplex printing, the two paper feeds, and the 6-color ink tanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printing
customer_reviews.text: Printing: Excellent quality, fast, ink life okay Copying: Good Scanning: Good Wireless setup: Had to manually configure but still could not get scanning to work. Cannon troubleshooting info no help when trying to install using their software. Software: Needs work. Especially when encountering wireless set-up errors. If Cannon software cannot recognize your printer wirelessly during install you then are faced with manually configuring the printer and trying to figure out how to install the software needed to enable the other printer functions. My config: Win7 Pro, New HP desktop. LinkSys Router
customer_reviews.author: J.B. from Indy

customer_reviews.title: Prints well but slow
customer_reviews.text: It prints nicely but I have not used it yet for photo printing so really can't speak to the machines ability there. I bought it for the recommendations by others and the bluetooth ability. Problem is that it take a minute or two to accept the order to print. Once the order is accepted it prints fast if you pick the fast mode. I haven't had to buy ink yet I am a little concerned that there are 6 cartitadges to change. I don't remember anyone telling me about this feature. Would I recommend this machine too early to say but I can say of the things I have mentioned they are a drawback for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble figuring out how to connect the wireless to both my desktop and laptop computer so I called tech support and they were great. They told me what to do and I was up and running quickly. The printer is the best printer I have ever had by far. My previous was a Canon MP500, before that several HP's. I particularly like the printer deciding which tray to pull paper from according to the job I had. My old printers I had to remember to switch trays to print photos, this printer does it automatically, no more wasting ink printing a photo on standard paper or a document a photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Mike

customer_reviews.title: So far - excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had good experiences with Canon products - scanners and cameras, so I decided to replace my HP photo printer with a Canon. The HP still works fine (very un-frugal of me to replace it), but our computer space is tight. The flexibility of a wireless connection appealed to me most. I chose a medium priced one. Set up was very easy and intuitive. It appeared on the network with no problem. Photo color is bright and accurate even on non-Canon paper. I have not tested the scanning & copying capabilities much. It is quick and easy. The printer also looks great - sleek black.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Z.

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse of a printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first venture with a wireless printer and having owned one all-in-one Canon before i was skeptical that this would be a piece of hardware worth writing about. I'm glad to report this printer was easy to set up, it worked flawlessly on the first attempt and the scanning and photographic printing modes were impressive. Photos using standard weight photo paper came out like lab prints. Ink use still sucks and is something printer companies better get a handle on otherwise it won't be worth to change out cartridges. All in all a good printer for direct connect and wireless printing and scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Stevep

customer_reviews.title: Great printer !!
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through Brother, Epson, and a number of HP's... they all fall way short of this puppy! It'll print every color of the rainbow... It's wireless so the rest of the family can print from their laptops. If you shop around, you can find non-OEM ink for cheap (I know what they say, but it hasn't failed me yet). Some reviews say it gobbles ink... Yeah, well there's a setting to minimize that, and if you're running this printer in an office with more than 4 or 5 people, get a printer designed for a professional office. This one was designed as a fairly high end home/office printer and it does very well at that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Eats Ink
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had read the ratings for this printer before I purchased it. It was easy to set up and I like the Wi-Fi printing capability. I don't like the fact that the grey ink cartridge showed half full after three 8x10's. I have printed less than 10 -8x10's and the other cartridges show significant consumption. The product of the print is good - I just don't want to spend that kind of money for ink. Solution? I might try cheaper inks which might compromise the quality of the picture. Next time I will read reviews of printer ink consumption, before I buy the printer.
customer_reviews.author: dnl

customer_reviews.title: Great for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: Haven't demanded much of this printer, but it has performed well for the tasks I've needed. Not really fast, but the text is crisp and the color rendition is true to the image on my monitor. Haven't had to replace the ink cartridges yet, but they are small. Luckily, you can change them individually. Makes nice copies, but again, it takes time to warm up and run through its diagnostics before outputting your documents. Small footprint, not horribly noisy, not ugly, a good little home printer
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Helderman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible 8.5/11" borderless glossy prints
customer_reviews.text: I'm blown away, the prints this thing is turning out are incredible. I'm surprised to be happy with the software too. I haven't timed the 8.5/11 glossy printing speed but it's very fast, certainly under a minute. I'm also very happy it has the black pigment cartridge since I like my docs laser-like on plain paper. And auto-duplex! What else can I say, gush gush, excellent printer. I guess I'll find out soon enough how much it's going to burn my budget ink cartridges, but at this point the prints are so good that I'm not that concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Mk

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer with one exception
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Canon Pixima MG6120 wireless inkjet photo printer and for the most part am pleased with it. I've come expect quality printing from Canon printers, having owned one other Canon all in one printer prior to this one. My only criticism as of this review is that I set it up on a wireless network and have found that the printing time is very slow, especially when printing documents that include images. Otherwise I would say that while there are undoubtedly better all in one printers on the market, this one it is definitely a good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: rjmartin

customer_reviews.title: It connects to the wifi network easily and I've never had problems printing to it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer just at three years now. I have it shoved back in a back room of the house on the opposite side from my router. It connects to the wifi network easily and I've never had problems printing to it. The scanner also works great over the network as well. It's a little annoying to have to complete actions at both the printer and the computer to complete a scan. However, like other post have stated, the machine goes through ink like crazy. Even when not printing color documents it uses color ink as though I were printing photos nonstop.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this unit. I've had other Canon printers and have had good luck with them. Unfortunately, this one couldn't even complete the setup process. It displayed an error message right out of the box. Canon tech support (which fortunately is in the US) advised that the print head carrier was not being released by the purge unit. This is apparently due to a manufacturing defect and is not user serviceable, so I'm returning the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Better than i expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the cannon PIXMA MG6120 a few weeks ago. It was easy to setup. I used the WiFi connection and loaded software on my Dell desktop, a dell laptop and a a Macpro. Very straight forward. prints great prints. The scanner is really easy to use. The text printing is very fast. I previously had a HP all in one photo printer. I was never happy with the photo printing and the scanning had much to be desired. I would very much recommend the cannon printer over the HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer
customer_reviews.text: We really like this printer and scanner. We did have trouble getting it to work wirelessly, but we don't mind using a usb cord It does a nice job scanning pictures and prints well. We don't use it that often, so ink usage hasn't been a problem. The initial cartridges do get used up fast, but they don't come filled as much as the ones you buy. We buy knock off cartridges on Amazon $10 for 6 and have no problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: Creilly84

customer_reviews.title: Best Wifi printer out there
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I have gone through multiple wifi printers over and so far this is the best one. First thing is that the wifi was a lot easier to set up and always works. We had an HP before that always lost connection to the router and had to reconnect it almost every week. Since we set up this one it always keeps its connection unless we turn off the router, which is normal. The print quality is great and fast. Will always buy Canon printers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Zabih

customer_reviews.title: Pixma MG6120
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this model after reading the reviews on the new 6320 model which owners complained that the touch screen was locking up. This may be last years model, but has buttons instead of a touch screen. My purchase was guided by Consumer Reports which rated this model number three. But, was rated the best for photo quality. I ordered it standard shipping and it was at my door three days after I ordered it, via Fed Ex.
customer_reviews.author: Bill34

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT ALL-IN-ONE PRINTER BY CANON!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one slick printer, copier and scanner. Everything, especially the photo printing, does an excellent job. I haven't had long enough to see how far the ink will go, but it all depends on how much you use it. It is a piano black which attracts dust, but I purchased a printer cover which protects it. I had no problem in setting up wireless. It just finds it without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: mh0508

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MG6120... GREAT Printer
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the printer long but my experience thus far has been nothing less than excellent. The printer was easy to setup on my network which shares both PC and MAC computers. The print quality is excellent and the features and software are numerous and great. I have had HP's for years and am so glad I made the switch. I did my research on all the printers that were comparable and every time I came back to the Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Madoug62

customer_reviews.title: Switched to Epson Artisan 837
customer_reviews.text: Thought this product came with a printable CD tray like it does in Australia. After purchasing it I found out the hard way that there is no printable CD tray available in the USA due to patent issues......Switched to EPson artisan 837....
customer_reviews.author: Natasha A Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Photo prints are not as clear as my older HP Printer. Scan's of Photos are not as clear as my older HP Printer. It goes through ink pretty quickly and runs check the canon printer cartridges for yourself before buying. After using genuine canon cartridges for the first six months, I can state that they are slightly better than cheap aftermarkets - just not good enough to justify the added cost. So, I've gone to inexpensive aftermarket refills, since the photos are sub-par either way. I won't buy this printer again, Hoping it dies soon so it can be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: EddyN

customer_reviews.title: Forget this is an all-in-one: this is a great printer.
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this printer, I thought you had to get a dedicated photo printer to get good prints. Not so! The Canon 6120 is the best photo printer I've ever owned. It is easy to print anything I've thrown at it. My wife loves the scanner and uses it all the time because it's so easy to figure out. There are fussy people in the world; but it's hard to believe there is anyone out there who wouldn't like this printer. It's the best I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Landers

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: After several HP printers failed I decided to try another manufacturer. This printer and scanner works flawlessly. The only gripe is that one of the six ink cartridges always seems to be empty. I feel like I'm always buying ink for it. Its not using a lot of ink, they just run out at different times rather than all about the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Wave

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: So far it is working great, I can scan old photos into my laptop an publish them on FaceBook,Snapfish etc. I dont plan on printing to many photos,It was easy to install turned it on followed instructions and was up and running in about half an hour. I will add more after some more useage. I also own a Canon T2i camera that is one reason I bought this printer, Canon quality!
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great. We replaced a Dell printer, which made installation of this one a little tricky. First I called Canon technical support, and they were great. I talked to a real person in Virginia. Unfortunately, there was a Dell file that had to be removed before the software for the Canon would install properly so I had to call Dell technical support. I was on the phone with Dell for TWO HOURS! Not Canon's fault, but beware if you are replacing a printer like I was. I wish I had bought the Canon to begin with! We chose this Canon ink jet because it was highly rated by Consumer Reports.
customer_reviews.author: Lori R.

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else!!
customer_reviews.text: It works sometimes, but I don't know what's more annoying--that it hums and whirs for 5 minutes before I print (Which Canon assured me is completely normal) or that it ALWAYS tries to print from the rear (photo paper) tray. Even when I set it to print from the front. And I'm pretty savvy with electronics, but this doesn't come through when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac Lion compatible
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new mac desktop in July and finally settled on this printer. My mac uses the new Lion OS, which is not compatible with this printer. Absolute nightmare. Update - I did get the printer to work after downloading and installing all the drivers for the Canon website. I've printed a few things and they look good. Haven't used any of the other functions yet.
customer_reviews.author: dasher

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, stylish and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I just took this out of the box and set it up, which took no time at all. It is already setup on my home network and ready to go. I brought it to print photos only. I printed a test photo and it came out perfectly. The colors pop just as they do on the screen. The onscreen manuel is very easy to navigate and the printer has a very nice modern look to it. I am very satifisfied with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Blue Rose

customer_reviews.title: Loved this printer
customer_reviews.text: Needed auto shut own. Kept coming in to printer didn't shut down correctly. American Electric Power kept shutting down momentarily over a period of time. The paper tray plus photo paper feed was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: ALL-in-One INK WASTER!
customer_reviews.text: Prints over your wifi network as advertised. Great print quality and picture quality for the price. GOBBLES UP INK LIKE A CRACK ADDICT! Even when I dont print colored documents or photos, my colored ink cartridges gets used up like way too quickly. It seems like the simple act of turning the printer on uses up ink. This printer should be called Photo ALL-in-One Ink Eater!
customer_reviews.author: BDiZzlE

customer_reviews.title: Slow printer
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this printer after using it for several years. It's very slow has no top feeding
customer_reviews.author: Ben James

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Outperforms any others of similar specification. I have used it with Windows XP, Windows 7 and Ubuntu 12.04. I've used the wired and wireless setup and all works better than I expected. The cover mounted buttons are VERY sensitive which prevents me from piling stuff on top (a bad habit I used to have). HP's flooding of ink stands has made getting ink for this or any other brand of printer a bit challenging but then, that's what the Internet is for.
customer_reviews.author: Belizekid

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: This has to be on of the best printers I have ever owned! It has fantastic network printing capabilities. I have 6 computers in my home network and they all connected flawlessly, whether they were wireless or hardline. I am also able to print from my DroidX. I have no complaints from this purchase. And Amazon Prime shipping rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Compulsive Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The ink dries out really fast and you can't print black and white if any of the color ink tanks are empty. The wireless only works sometimes and is a hassle to set up. The print quality is fine. The printer itself is inexpensive. The duplex printing is slow but works fine. The printer takes a long time to warm up. I very much regret buying this printer. I wish I'd purchased a black and white laser printer instead. Do not buy this printer unless you really plan on doing a lot of color printing. Otherwise, it just isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Foxtrot

customer_reviews.title: not as good as it sounds
customer_reviews.text: purchased based on some through Amazon. It was fairly easy to set up, however, only prints half a page of anything I select to print. doesn't matter if I am printing a picture or document. Often times I get a message that the printer is offline. Should be easy enough set up and use. I shouldn't have to do all this problem solving right out of the box. Pain in the butt!!
customer_reviews.author: triguy

customer_reviews.title: you won'tbe dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the printer I was using since I enter photo shows and submit photos to a stock agency I needed excellant results. After shopping around for along time I decided to purchase the Pixma. I was not disappointed. I am now getting top quality prints, lab quality. The only quirk I noticed was that until you break the printer in, you tend to use more ink; but after replacing the cartridges once, that has settled down to normal usage. Great product Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene4ever

customer_reviews.title: Used Canon MG6120
customer_reviews.text: I once was a very satisfied owner of a Canon MG6120 printer. When I needed a new printer, I didn't hesitate to purchase this used machine. The printer was exactly as described and appeared as good or better than my previous machine. The machine is currently on my WiFi and has worked flawlessly during the past two months. I would recommend Canon products and would also recommend this seller. All correspondence with this seller prior to the purchase has been professional and prompt. Made the purchase easy and worry-free.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Printer does not work if any one cartridge is empty
customer_reviews.text: Too many print cartridges needed. They run out pretty fast and refill is expensive. Just black printing also consumes other colors, so you have to refill all of them. Printer does not work if any one of them is empty.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeReading

customer_reviews.title: downside of this
customer_reviews.text: I had a Dell printer prior to getting the Canon. My biggest complaint is the amount of ink it goes thru and the cost! Also, it takes a good length of time to warm up before printing. On the positive side, it does a fine job of printing. I would return to the Dell had I to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane P. Dovel

customer_reviews.title: Okay but wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: The way this printer grunts and tweets for several minutes before deigning to print drives me nuts. It does an okay job. It's pretty slow, guzzles ink and isn't easy to set up for wireless use.
customer_reviews.author: Dinah

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best printers I have ever owned! Yes, the ink usage is higher... but if you are willing to use a little more ink to satisfy the photography perfectionist in you, then this is a great buy. My wife is loves taking pictures and prints them at home. It was well worth it to me to see the look of appreciation and happiness on her face when she printed the first pictures on this wonder!
customer_reviews.author: Kasper

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: This was my 1st wireless printer and so far I couldn't have made a better choice. This printer's great. I could be sitting on my couch with my laptop & send a command to the printer. For someone who's not technologically advanced, it took 20 minutes to set up the printer. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I had a refurbished Canon Printer previously. MP560. Was very unhappy with it. I am a Canon Printer fan. So I decided to spend a little more this time around. I am very happy with it thus far. It prints great a the photo prints are awesome. This printer is much sturdier then the previous Canon printers I have had. Since this is very new thus far, I will not say more, but will post any updates later.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Ink does not last long!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer, but the price of the ink will kill you! I only use mine about 3 times a month and I put it in draft mode to save on it, but I still have to spend $80 a year to replace all 6 ink cartridges! I found that the ink cartrigdes from Sophia are way cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Jay ManTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: problems.....
customer_reviews.text: the quality of the printing is good.....but it is incredibly slow to 'get going' - no easy quick start up to print a page or two......just takes a lonnnnng time to start printing. Have never had a slower-to-respond printer......AND the ink runs out VERY quickly and needs replacing MUCH too often.... ANOTHER GLITCH: I set the paper feed to auto - but all too often, it won't 'read' whether to load paper from the rear or the front.... Disappointed with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome photo quality!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new printer to replace our Epson Stylus and wanted good photo quality since we print our own 5x7's and 8x10's. We also chose this printer for the wireless capability. The photo color quality is awesome and the wireless setup was quite easy to do. The only negative I have to say about this printer is that the ink cartridges are expensive and you have 6 to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Nancyann

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one for me. The first ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one for me. The first one lasted over four years and I did a lot of printing with it. So far this one is living up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Derald E. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap printer but the Canon cartridges are major cost.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has to have 6 different cartrides to work. Sometimes when I turn it on it just sits for 2 or 3 minutes making various noises and displays a message to "wait". Other wise it does a good job and is cheap. If you get one buy after market ink cartridges-they work fine and cost a third of the Canon cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: wolfkin

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I just got this printer, I did read alot of the reviews before I bought it. I will like to give a more extensive review in a month or two. The set up was a breeze and that really shocked me because I am not techical. So far I love it. printer photo beautiful and easy. documents really clear and copy and scan also. I would recommend this printer to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer with expensive ink
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer but if you don't use it often, the ink dries up. I have had to replace the ink three times in one year just from non-use. I only print out a few things a month and yet, I still go through a lot of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Chief G

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all-in-one. Was incredibly easy to set up, get connected to my network and use from my PC. It produces good quality output on all media types. So far I am completely satisfied. Boots up and connects every time without any hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: Pallas

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all the major brands over the years, including previous versions of Canon printers. This one beats them all from installation to performance. The wireless feature is wonderful and painless to set-up on all my house and visiting laptops.
customer_reviews.author: James Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Inhales the Toner!
customer_reviews.text: This printer works well but it's expensive to use. It goes through toner even more quickly than my old Canon printer. Wish I had gotten something different.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Ever Ready
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Always works and gives good quality print. Not the best with pictures though. I've had it awhile too. Reminder to turn it back on if your power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Key West Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MG6120 printer
customer_reviews.text: I had read the reviews about this printer and after purchasing I am very pleased with the quality of print. I have used HP's but was frustrated with buying expensive cartridges frequently so I wanted to try something different and very glad I did. Was also happy with how quickly it was shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Williams

customer_reviews.title: An excellent printer........but
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent printer, but beware! Replacing the ink is nearly as expensive as buying a new printer. It is easy to use, works well with my laptop, via my home router. No wires. Good quality printing. Except for the cost of ink, I'd give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is user friendly. The photos we have printed have turned out real well. The ink cartridges are not fast used up as some printers I have had. Have recommended to other people.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Eats ink
customer_reviews.text: Maybe all printers eat ink, but I hate putting in all new cartridges and after a few months of light use, getting low ink messages. Also, this printer takes 6 cartridges, and Canon only sells 5 packs. You have to buy the gray separately. What is up with that?
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Fay

customer_reviews.title: The one small complaint with the printer is the amount ...
customer_reviews.text: The one small complaint with the printer is the amount of ink it uses. Apparently this is a common issue with most printers.
customer_reviews.author: gmdupe

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I am more than pleased with my new All-In-One Canon MG6120. Only problem was setting up the WI-FI. Instrustions which there are many for the WI-FI application can be confusing. I would highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick TB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photos but slow and uses ink like it was water
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - The Pixma MG6120 produces beautiful images ... photos and text. - The user interface is superb. - Configuring computers to use the Wi-Fi link to print is easy. - The printer looks great especially when the output door is closed. Then it looks like a svelte black box. Cons: - It uses ink quickly. - When it is turned on, one has to wait as much as 30 seconds before it is ready to print. Summary: Because I print few photos, I would not purchase this printer again due to its heavy consumption of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: MG6120
customer_reviews.text: The most important attribute in a printer for me is high photo quality and this particular model is the best I have experienced. I did consider other models but, after having tried them out, the MG6120 gave superior results. Also, my previous printer was a Canon and is still in use after five years of moderate to heavy use as I gave it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: W. ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Printer !
customer_reviews.text: I waited a good three months before writing a review for this printer...Wanted to make sure I used all the functions in their entirety. Simply put, the printer has exceeded all my expectations...HP Who ?
customer_reviews.author: xtreema

customer_reviews.title: Complete Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I each have laptops ( as well as having a Desktop in the house) and so getting a wifi printer made sense rather than going to the desktop eveytime we wanted to print something. We did our research and thought that for the money this one was the one for us. We ordered it and it was here within a week. THe setup was so very easy ( we are NOT tech savvy) and the quality of prints and Photos is very good. I would highly reccomend this printer to anyone needing a wifi printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bacchusbrat

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Though I don't come near using all its capabilities, I am happy I can purchase individual colors without having to pay the cost of a single cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Veteranchuck

customer_reviews.title: Not so great color
customer_reviews.text: I never read before I buy, wanted a fax, copier, printer, but it's not a fax. Color is not as good as HP's. Photo prints are not good. Runs out of ink quickly. The only good thing about it is that it prints fast
customer_reviews.author: rosita nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: Have used the printer for some time and it works well. It gives very nice photo prints and so far hasn't dried up. Ink supply does last too long howeve,
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: MG6120
customer_reviews.text: I love my new printer. it is fast for text and my everyday photos. I am having trouble with the wireless feature but I needed it printer for everyday and have not spent the time to make it wireless
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, okay configuration
customer_reviews.text: The MFC, as a directly connected device performs wonderfully. The quality is great for the price and the physical set up was quite simple. I do take exception with the configuration. As a wireless printer/scanner, there is little/no capability to modify configurations that are not being given by the router. Online support for these functions is sadly nonexistent. For basic features it is wonderful. For those wanting to tailor it to their network, there may be issues.
customer_reviews.author: XENOPHON

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Had it for years
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Had it for years. Does not use too much ink. I buy it in bulk off amazon
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this printer, owned cannon printers before but this one works well and trouble free. will buy cannon again.
customer_reviews.author: doug- florida.

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey ink
customer_reviews.text: Good printer/photo printer but the supplies are expensive and the cartridges small and don't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. White

customer_reviews.title: Great home printer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is excellent. easy to use, wireless, great color. It is a bit greedy with ink, it has a gray and 2 different black. but I don't seem to be swapping out cartridges that often, so that is good.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer I've ever purchased. With the wifi not having to plug directly in to either my computer or router is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This Canon printer works like a charm. Absolutely reliable and does beautiful printing. Printing of color photos is by far the best I have ever had. Use as a copier and/or scanner is also easy and efficient. I have had many printers from several other manufacturers and can say that this Canon is worlds better than any of them. Thank you Canon. Ed England
customer_reviews.author: Lancaster Kid

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printer
customer_reviews.text: After several disappointments with HP printers, I returned to Canon with the Canon 6120. I am delighted. The printer has met every expectation. The software worked smoothly, and the printer has produced excellent copies and photos without error!
customer_reviews.author: BESQ

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for its wireless capability and I liked the addition of a grey ink tank - I print a lot of B/W photos. The printer set up and installed effortlessly. I got it connected to my wireless network in about 5 minutes, and it prints beautifully from both my PC and my MacBook Pro. Canon has also made it easy to print with ICC profiles, so now much easier to play with Photoshop. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Ink hog
customer_reviews.text: Fast but goes through ink rapidly. Ink cartridge capacity is too small. Hasn't been a problem in a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: HosteenHoskieBegay

customer_reviews.title: Terrific printer!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is fantastic - all the way around. Better than any printer I have ever purchased. Fast speed, great print quality and after checking consumer reports it is rated number 2 over all others.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Best printer
customer_reviews.text: This Canon replaces an HP printer which was my 4th. I finally took some advice and changed to this Canon .The HP service has left America and I can't understand poor broken English. So far, this Canon is everything I was told and very pleased with the quality and professional looking photo prints. Highly recommend..........
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to purchase the Canon PIXMA MG8120, but due to cost restraints, opted for this one. A great choice after all. I especially enjoy the sleek design, automatic paper feeder and wireless integration. The scan and print quality can all be adjusted and I've only used lower, ink-saving settings so far, resulting in my lower rating for those features. Easy setup and user-friendly menus. A great all-in-one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. I especially like the paper feed tray. Print quality is good and has ability to double side print which is also nice. Many features for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Zacky

customer_reviews.title: Expensive toner
customer_reviews.text: This thing burns through toner. After printing a small number of mostly greyscale word documents for my home business I somehow burned up all of the color toner. It doesn't work well if you only replace the black and gray toner cartridges, even on greyscale. Plus, replacement toner comes in very strange combo packs...
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my hp all-in-one with this printer. Setup was seamless and painless. Manual needs help, not very instructional. printer works great and makes fantastic pictures with the Canon glossy paper.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA  MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: THIS thing is THE BOMB!!!!!! Had it about a year and LOVE it, the 6 inkwells don't bother me at all, the pictures I print are AWESOME!!!!!! Look gorgeous. I use this thing alllllll the time.
customer_reviews.author: Blairwitch4567

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I have ever owned in my home. It works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and EASY setup
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Looks good and prints well. I set up a Mac laptop and a PC desktop to the printer in about 15 minutes while the printer was connected via wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this copier/printer/scanner on a friends recommendation and am very pleased with the ease of use and the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Baum

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This printer is stylish and The touch surface lighted controls are great. Easy to set up and easy to use. I haven't printed much but what I have printed is fine. I'd recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ron77

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced a much more expensive one, and it works great. It's fast, the quality is great, and the ink dries fast. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Salamun

customer_reviews.title: wireless headaches
customer_reviews.text: After a couple months of light usage, the wireless printing suddenly stopped working. I tried re-installing the drivers unsuccessfully on several machines. Extensive tech support (via both phone and email) has been of no help. I've spent over 10 hours fighting this issue and I'm throwing in the towel ... no more Canon for me.
customer_reviews.author: briand66

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is truly amazing! The photos are Gorgeous! I am very pleased with this printer. Could not be happier! Top notch!
customer_reviews.author: shannaj104

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer unless you want to spend a fortune on ink and waste a lot of time. There are 2 black ink cartridges and if one is out, the printer will not work until you buy more. This only makes since from a business prospective that only cares about $.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M. Scamehorn

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-in-One Printer (4503B002)
product_meta.description:
Canon PIXMA MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One: High Performance Wireless1 Photo All-In-One with Intelligent Touch System, Gray Ink and Built-In Auto Duplex Printing. The PIXMA MG6120 delivers high performance, quality and true ease of use in one, sleek machine. It begins with a revolutionary interface that Canon has created where the top of your printer turns into a sleek, ultra-responsive touch panel. The Intelligent Touch System provides light-guided direction with gorgeous touch sensitive controls so only the buttons you need light up. Your fingers will realize fluid, effortless operation where once you choose your function you’re one step away from imaging brilliance.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Canon PIXMA MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One: High Performance Wireless1 Photo All-In-One with Intelligent Touch System, Gray Ink and Built-In Auto Duplex Printing 

 The PIXMA MG6120 delivers high performance, quality and true ease of use in one, sleek machine. It begins with a revolutionary interface that Canon has created where the top of your printer turns into a sleek, ultra-responsive touch panel. The Intelligent Touch System provides light-guided direction with gorgeous touch sensitive controls so only the buttons you need light up. Your fingers will realize fluid, effortless operation where once you choose your function you’re one step away from imaging brilliance. 

OVERVIEW

CANON PIXMA MG6120 WIRELESS INKJET PHOTO ALL-IN-ONE
 

High Performance Wireless1 Photo All-In-One with Intelligent Touch System, Gray Ink and Built-In Auto Duplex Printing

 * All-new Intelligent Touch System allows you to effortlessly operate your machine with gorgeous touch sensitive buttons
 * Six individual ink system featuring gray ink for professional-looking black & white photos
 * All new Full HD Movie Print software turns your favorite HD movie clips captured with your compatible Canon EOS Digital SLR or PowerShot cameras into beautiful prints2
 * Maximum 9600 x 2400 color dpi3 for exceptional photo quality
 * Keep it eco-conscious: Built-in 2-sided printing helps the environment and cuts your paper usage by up to 50%



Click here for a larger image 
 For the first time in home photo printing your HD Movie moments can now become beautiful photos with your new PIXMA printer. Full HD Movie Print2 turns your favorite HD movie clips captured with compatible Canon EOS Digital SLR or PowerShot cameras into beautiful photo prints. Built-in Wi-Fi1 lets you easily print and scan wirelessly with the added ability to print your photos from compatible iPhone, iPod touch and AndroidTM devices4. Produce true photo lab quality prints at home with a maximum print resolution of 9600 x 2400 dpi3 and six individual ink tanks including a gray ink for professional color and black & white photos. Plus, Auto Document Fix delivers beautiful, easy-to-view scans by advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction, automatically. 

 Join the Generation Green initiative with Built-in Auto Duplex Printing, which allows you to automatically print on both sides of the paper and can help reduce your paper usage by up to 50%. Don’t feel like using a computer? No problem. Just insert a compatible memory card5 into the built in card slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! Thanks to a PictBridge6 connection you can also print photos directly from your compatible digital camera, DV camcorder or camera phone, and even with the optional BU-30 wireless Bluetooth7 unit. Enjoy previewing and editing images on a 3.0" Color LCD and print a beautiful, borderless 4" x 6" image in approx. 20 seconds8. 



FEATURES & BENEFITS

 

SPEED & QUALITY



Extraordinary Resolution:
Realize the power of 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi firing with 1pl. Benefit? Incredible quality and detail in both your business documents and photos.3 


High Performance Six Individual Ink Tank System:
This 6-color ink system consists of five dye-based inks including a dedicated gray ink tank for professional-looking black & white and color photos. A pigment-based black ink produces exceptionally crisp, laser-quality text. Plus, only replace the color ink tank that runs out. 


ChromaLife100+:
This system combines enhanced FINE print head technology with select genuine Canon inks and select genuine Canon photo papers for beautiful borderless photos that will last up to 300 years when stored in an archival-quality photo album9. 

Print Beautiful, Borderless Photos Fast:
Print a borderless, 4" x 6" in approximately 20 seconds.8 

 

EASE OF USE


Intelligent Touch System:
This all-new button navigation system allows you to effortlessly operate your machine with gorgeous touch sensitive controls. 


Full HD Movie Print:
The all new Full HD Movie Print software turns your favorite HD movie clips captured with your compatible Canon EOS Digital SLR or PowerShot cameras into beautiful prints.2 


 Built-In Auto Duplex Printing:
Automatically print on both sides of the page without the hassle of turning it over manually. This saves you time, helps the environment and can cut your paper usage by up to 50%. 

Scroll Wheel:
Easily and quickly access and select the various features available for faster operation. 

3.0" LCD:
Easily view, select and edit your images for simple computer-free printing. No downloading needed, just pick your pic and print! 


Auto Photo Fix II:
This built-in technology automatically categorizes your images into one of five types - Portrait, Scenery, Night Scenery, Snapshot with Scenery, and Snapshot with Night Scenery - then applies optimal image and multi-zone exposure correction. So, unexposed areas of the photo will be optimized, area by area and faces that are backlit and under-exposed will automatically be brightened with correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones for gorgeous images. 


Auto Document Fix:
Auto Document Fix delivers beautiful, easy-to-view scans by advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction, automatically. So, your document text can be darkened with pronounced edges for clear, sharp text that’s easy to read, and pictures will maintain color tone and contrast. 

Auto Scan Mode:
Automatically recognizes the type of original being scanned, then scans and saves with the suitable settings.12 


Quick Start:
Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button you can begin inputting commands in mere seconds. So, full operation is possible in a much shorter time. 

2-Way Paper Feeding:
To add to your options this feature lets you load paper from the front cassette or rear tray so whether your home office or photo lab is open, you’re ready to print! 

Beautiful & Borderless:
Print photo lab quality from 4" x 6" up to 8.5" x 11."10 

 

CONNECTIVITY


Built-In Wireless:
Print or scan wirelessly from any Wi-Fi enabled computer around the house.1 


 Smart Phone Printing:
Take full advantage of Canon’s fantastic Wi-Fi printing technology to unlock, print and share your stored images right on the spot. Print your photos wirelessly from compatible iPhone, iPod touch and AndroidTM devices.4 


Built-In Ethernet:
This wired LAN interface lets you connect to a home or office network, with connected computers sharing the power of this versatile machine, each being able to display the printer’s status at any moment. 




Memory Cards5 / USB11 / PictBridge6 & Optional Bluetooth7:

Don’t feel like using a computer? No problem. Just insert a compatible memory card into the built in card slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! Thanks to a PictBridge connection you can also print photos directly from your digital camera, DV camcorder or camera phone. Plus, you can print from the optional BU-30 wireless Bluetooth unit. 

Hi-Speed USB:
Plug the cable into your PC for a super-fast connection for your data transfers. 

 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES & BENEFITS


Fast Document Printing:
Print black and white, and color documents in the official print speed measure (images per minute) for one, four page Excel document, one, four page Word document and one, four page PDF document.14 

 Optical Scanning Resolution:
Produces high quality, 4800 x 4800 dpi scans for incredible image detail. 


Easy-WebPrint EX:
Print what you want off the web, easily. Easy-WebPrintEX allows you to create your own layout, take different sections of different websites and put them all on one page. Move, resize and trim your clips, insert notes and edit text, make it a portrait or landscape, print up to 3 columns on a page and even save the layout as a PDF file.13 

Stay True To The Original:
This built-in technology automatically optimizes your copy quality based on the type of original you’re copying. 

Click here for a larger image 
COMPATIBILITY

 * Windows® 7,Windows Vista®, Windows XP/200015
 * Mac OS® X v. 10.4.11 to 10.6.x15


WHAT'S IN THE BOX

 * PIXMA MG6120 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One
 * Document Kit: Cross Sell Sheet, Getting Started, Important Information Sheet, Networking Troubleshooting Guide, Safety Environment Information, Setup Software & User’s Guide CD-ROM, Warranty Card
 * Ink Tanks: PGI-225 Pigment Black, CLI-226 (Cyan/Magenta/Yellow/Black/Gray)
 * Power Cord
 * Print Head
 * Sample Media (PP-201 4" x 6"/3 Sheets)


COMPARE

PIXMA MG5220 Wireless Photo All-In-One PIXMA MG6120
Wireless Photo All-In-One PIXMA MG8120 Wireless Photo All-In-One CURRENTLY VIEWING
Functions Print, Copy, Scan, Photo Print, Copy, Scan, Photo Print, Copy, Scan, Photo Speed & Quality ISO Print Speed (up to)14 / 
4" x 6" Borderless Photo8 Print Resolution (up to)3 / 
Minimum Ink Droplet Size Individual Ink Tanks Maximum Scan Resolution Ease of Use Slide & Negative Scanning - - Intelligent Touch System - LCD Display Full HD Movie Print Software Included2 Advanced Media Handling Fun Printing Projects Connectivity Built-In Networking1 Direct Photo Printing4,5,6,7 USB Connectivity 
GENUINE CANON INKS & PAPER

CLI-226 Cyan CLI-226 Magenta CLI-226 Yellow CLI-226 Black CLI-226 Gray PGI-225 Pigment Black 
PGI-225 Black Twin Pack Value Pack Canon PGI-225 BK / CLI-226 C,M,Y 4 Pack Value Pack Canon CLI-226 BK,C,M,Y with PP-201 50 Sheets Combo Pack Click Here for Genuine Canon Papers 
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

DISCLAIMERS
 1.  Wireless printing requires a working network with wireless 802.11b/g capability. Wireless performance may vary based on terrain and distance between the printer and wireless network clients. "Full HD Movie Print" is available from "MOV" movie files created by Canon digital cameras. From PC, or Mac with Intel® processor. Requires Canon ZoomBrowser EX 6.5 or later, or Canon ImageBrowser 6.5 or later. Resolution may vary based on printer driver setting. Color ink droplets can be placed with a horizontal pitch of 1/9600 inch at minimum. Requires Canon Easy-PhotoPrint for iPhone app, available for free on the App StoreSM, or Canon Easy-PhotoPrint for Android app available for free in the Android Market. Compatible with iPhone 3G, 3GS, 4, iPod touch and Android devices running Android OS 1.6 or later. Compatible memory cards include SDTM Memory Card, SDHCTM, MultiMediaCard®, MultiMediaCard® Plus, CompactFlash® Card, Microdrive®, Memory Stick®, Memory Stick PROTM, Memory Stick DuoTM and Memory Stick PRO DuoTM. The following can be used with the addition of a special adapter sold separately: miniSDTM Card, miniSDHCTM, microSDTM Card, microSDHCTM, RS-MMCTM, Memory Stick Micro, xD-Picture Card®, xD-Picture Card® (Type M), and xD-Picture Card® (Type H). Requires mobile phone equipped with PictBridge technology and a USB cable. Requires mobile phone (or other device) equipped with Bluetooth v2.0 technology and optional Canon Bluetooth Unit BU-30. Bluetooth operation depends on the device and software version used. Operating distance is approx. 10 meters but may vary due to obstacles, radio signals, locations where radio interference occurs, magnetic fields from microwave ovens, device sensitivity and/or antenna performance. Photo print speeds are based on the standard mode driver setting using photo test pattern(s) and select Canon Photo Paper. Print speed measured as soon as first page begins to feed into printer and will vary depending on system configuration, interface, software, document complexity, print mode, types of paper used and page coverage. See www.usa.canon.com/printspeed for additional details. Based on accelerated testing by Canon in dark storage under controlled temperature, humidity and gas conditions, simulating storage in an album with plastic sleeves. Canon cannot guarantee the longevity of prints; results may vary depending on printed image, drying time, display/storage conditions, and environmental factors. See www.usa.canon.com/chromalife100plus for additional details. Supported paper types for borderless printing are as follows: Photo Paper Pro Platinum, Photo Paper Plus Glossy II, Photo Paper Plus Semi-gloss, Photo Paper Glossy and Matte Photo Paper. USB flash memory with security enabled may not be used. Requires an extension cable if cannot be attached. 
    
    Additional Disclaimers For network users, Auto Scan Mode is only available when scanning at a computer using MP Navigator EX software and selecting the 1-click feature then "save to PC". Compatible with Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 in Windows 7, Windows Vista or Windows XP only. Not included on installation CD. Requires Internet connection during installation. ISO/IEC 24734, 24735 define the default print and copy speed measurement methods. Print speeds are the averages of ESAT in Office Category Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24734, excluding time to print the first set. ADF copy speed is the average of ESAT in General Performance Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24735, excluding time to copy the first set. See www.usa.canon.com/ipm for additional details. System requirements vary by application. Warranty programs are subject to certain conditions and restrictions. See www.usa.canon.com/support for details.

See all customer images Top reviews Most recent Top reviews THERE WAS A PROBLEM FILTERING REVIEWS RIGHT NOW. PLEASE TRY AGAIN LATER.
B. Wong1.0 out of 5 stars All in One Printer alright. It's all about the ink!!!Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2013Verified Purchase Pros: Great scanner, converts images to jpeg or pdf. The software that comes with it takes getting use to. Wish it was more simpler to use, but some of the functions actually is useful like scanning words to text for you to edit.

Cons:
*Takes about 1-2 minutes to print the first document after it does it's cleaning or whatever checking it's going through.
*None of the functions will work unless the ink cartridges are in place with ink in it. You can't scan a document, even though you're not printing anything, without the ink cartridges installed. Empty ink cartridges won't help.
*This machine is seriously an ink gobbler. Hardly printed any colored documents and already the color ink cartridges are low are near empty. Bought a 6 pack of no-frills replacement ink for roughly $10. Barely printed a document and already the light is blinking indicating low ink for the big fat black cartridge. You'd think that would last twice as long as the colored inks especially when you just opened the pack.
*Seems like when the printer is idled. The area where the printer head is parked (on the right, inside the cover) is a sponge that's suppose to clean the printer head, but I think it's actually causing the inks to leak out.

Notes
*Copier - haven't tried using it. I was afraid I'd run out of ink.
*I guess it's Canon's way of making extra money from sales of ink cartridges. Whether it's their ink or a no-frills brand.
*Yeah, I know the price is really hard to resist, but it's really better off getting a color laser printer or a black and white all-in-one machine. You can get either for under $200 (Brother). The price you're going to spend to replace the ink cartridges will eventually cover a toner cartridge. And if you want to print photos, just do it at a Costco or CVS store instead.Read more 6 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse iMe VINE VOICE 5.0 out of 5 stars Simply AmazingReviewed in the United States on November 19, 2010Verified Purchase Canon has done such an amazing job with this printer, not only performance wise, but also on quality, design and ease of use. I used to own a Canon MP500, but later needed a wireless printer. I was recommended to get an HP because of their good reputation, larger ink cartridges, and lower cost to maintain - which to an extent was true, ink on the HP lasted me about 6-months compered to the MP500's 3-4 months, and the HP ink also cost less. In reality, who cares how much the ink cost, when the HP was the noisiest thing in my office, slower than snail-mail (exaggerating), and it printed the most horrible images and documents. ...or maybe it was just me since I had already experienced what Canon was capable of.

I am really happy I purchased the Canon MG6120. Within the last month, I've purchased a MacBook Air, iMac, Time Capsule and HP Media Server, and all I can say is that I really don't care about those gadgets, I'm simply super excited about my printer purchase - it is by far the best printer I have ever used - it't print quality is on par with the thousand dollar printers my company purchases for media services.

Installation was a breeze, it's just a matter of unpacking the printer, removing all the wrap on it, aligning the print heads, and using it's cool mini LCD to input my wireless network info. Once that's done, simply insert the driver CD into the computer and follow the on-screen instructions (pretty much just click "next" over and over after telling it it's a wireless setup. The only thing that I found a bit annoying was that I had to install using the CD on all 3 of my computers, where on the HP I just had to install one one computer, and after than all the other computers could find it on the network. I might be missing something, so it might be my fault and not Canon's - I'm no network expert. I have been able to get Canon app to work from the iPad; it's only good for pictures though.

Those of you needing high print quality will not be one bit disappointed with this printer. The scanner also works really well, I've already used it to send scans to my computer, and to make photo copies. After creating a photocopy, several people had issues trying to determine which was the original document, which did have an actual pen-written signature.Read more 19 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Amazon Customer1.0 out of 5 stars Canon PIXMA MG6120 Has Not Worked Well for MeReviewed in the United States on February 29, 2012Verified Purchase I purchased this printer on March 2, 2011 based on the wonderful reviews that I've seen everywhere. My printer worked okay until October 2011. The black ink stopped working. After some troubleshooting Cannon sent new ink cartridges. That did not resolve the issue. Then they sent a replacement printer head, but that did not resolve the issue either. In December 2011 Cannon offered me another printer which turned out to be refurbished. I don't know what I'm in for now with this refurbished printer. Well it worked okay in December and January. In mid February 2012 the same problem arose, this time the blue ink was the issue. Cannon has sent a new printer head and I'll have to wait and see how long this one lasts. It has been almost a year and this is (IMO) a lot of issues to have with a printer brand new or refurbished. I print five or six pages a few times a week, so it is not like it gets heavy use. When it works I'm happy. Another thing to note is that the ink is very expensive and does not last long. The mechanism that is supposed to keep the printer head functioning uses up most of the ink. I have done some research via the internet to find a solution to the printer head issue and have found that this is a common issue with this type of printer. It seems that the printer head gets clogged or dries out if you don't use the printer everyday. Cannon support suggested that I leave the printer on at all times so that the printer head will self clean. The research from the forums suggest that I print one color page a week which uses far less ink than using the printer utilities to keep the printer head unclogged.

I have two Dell printers one is 5 years old and one is 8 years old and I've never had any problems with them at all. I needed a wireless printer for my laptop, phone, tablet, etc. My Canon PIXMA MG6120 is just not what I expected.Read more 6 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States
